alert.note: Alert for Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Fresno-Clovis; Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Mariposa Madera Foothills; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 5:55AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Mariposa, south central Madera, southwestern Tuolumne, east central Merced and central Fresno Counties through 630 AM PST... At 553 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Smith Station to near Kerman. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Merced observation at the airport. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fresno, Clovis, Madera, Kerman, Madera Acres, Yosemite Lakes, Parkwood, Parksdale, Biola, Bootjack, Bonadelle Ranchos-Madera Ranchos, Mariposa, Hetch Hetchy Ranger Station, Lower Kibbie Ridge, El Portal, Millerton Lake, Catheys Valley, Coarsegold, Jerseydale and Crane Flat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Hanford CA.
